docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: As the death toll from AIDS continues to mount and hopes recede for developing a vaccine or cure any time soon, the nation is turning more vigorously and more desperately to the only available defenses against the epidemic: prevention.

headline.main: FOR NOW, LONE WEAPON ON AIDS IS PREVENTION

docs.snippet: LEAD: As the death toll from AIDS continues to mount and hopes recede for developing a vaccine or cure any time soon, the nation is turning more vigorously and more desperately to the only available defenses against the epidemic: prevention.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Before the end of the year, medical experts say, up to a hundred Americans will roll up their sleeves for injections of experimental vaccines against AIDS.

headline.main: TEST ON HUMANS NEAR IN AIDS VACCINE HUNT

docs.snippet: LEAD: Before the end of the year, medical experts say, up to a hundred Americans will roll up their sleeves for injections of experimental vaccines against AIDS.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The suicide attempt yesterday morning by two young people in Bergenfield, N.J., which closely copied the death of four teen-agers last week, fits a pattern of imitation that often comes after well-publicized suicides, according to experts.

headline.main: PATTERN OF DEATH: COPYCAT SUICIDES AMONG YOUTHS

docs.snippet: LEAD: The suicide attempt yesterday morning by two young people in Bergenfield, N.J., which closely copied the death of four teen-agers last week, fits a pattern of imitation that often comes after well-publicized suicides, according to experts.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: This year the AIDS epidemic is being transformed from an utterly hopeless situation to one in which many, perhaps most American victims of the disease will have access to drug treatments that may give precious extra months of life.

headline.main: AIDS DRUGS OFFER HOPE BUT CURE REMAINS DISTANT

docs.snippet: LEAD: This year the AIDS epidemic is being transformed from an utterly hopeless situation to one in which many, perhaps most American victims of the disease will have access to drug treatments that may give precious extra months of life.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: An independent Federal advisory panel of medical experts recommended today that the Food and Drug Administration grant approval for the first time to a remedy for baldness.
docs.snippet: LEAD: An independent Federal advisory panel of medical experts recommended today that the Food and Drug Administration grant approval for the first time to a remedy for baldness.

byline.original: By IRVIN MOLOTSKY, Special to the New York Times
